column4: hello, who is the responsible (maintainers) for the 'multiverse' packages ?
we (MOTU) are.
so is it possible to ask tp 'update' a package ?
only in Dapper.
i see. is there a wishlist somewhere to ask for this ?
the ubuntu-motu mailing list, #ubuntu-motu, or the wiki for UniverseCandidates
thanks for the info, i'll have a look
i've read read the wiki you told me -> so what should I do ? send an email to the mailing list ? the package is already in breezy/dapper but at an old version
we don't touch breezy except for security/grave updates
dapper is feasible
ok so go for dapper. what is the next step to get this package ("gpac") updated ?
file a bug on malone for it
ok, cheers :-)
by the way, is it normal that my package is unknown on malone (but exists on packages.ubuntu.com for dapper of course) ?
you can ask for it to be added in #launchpad

as a heads up, we may not be doing anything with gpac in the near future (or we may depending on upstream's productivity), see the huge number of changes in http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/gpac/gpac/Changelog?rev=1.25&view=markup
do you mean you will wait for a 'stable' gpac release ?
if it's within a few weeks, yes
and if it's not ? couldn't you use the latest 0.4.0 release ? by the way, it may be a good idea to separate gpac and libgpac, as they seem to have done in BSD ports
what uses gpac as a lib that's in ubuntu's repo?
you must be right. i thought about this because now gpac can be used as a lib only to develop other software
